subject: Re: [junit] Adding NotImplmented interface to JUnit
msgSnippet: On Sat, 25 Sep 2004 12:53:44 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger ... As opposed to simply prepending a character or string to the test name, which would hide it from
messageBody:
On Sat, 25 Sep 2004 12:53:44 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> As an alternative, use the JUnit-addons test runner, which ignores tests
> whose names end in _ignored.

As opposed to simply prepending a character or string to the test
name, which would hide it from JUnit?


public void untestSomethingImWorkingOn() throws Exception { // XXX
make this work
some code that I really wish worked properly
}
